channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC

item.title: Report E-2024080273
item.description:
Report E-2024080273

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-4ft area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that forty (40) pounds of material was released due to a forklift damaging one (1) plastic bag. First Call Environmental personnel moved all the plastic bags from the pallet to verify only one (1) bag was damaged and then swept up the released material. The damaged bag and recovered material were placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was brought to the QA cage by a van line manager because of a wet spot and smell coming from the package. Upon inspection, we discovered that 2 of the caps were loose which caused the spill. We made sure to place this package in a lined hazmat tote and moved it to the hazmat cage.

item.description:
Report X-2024080518

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: GREENSBORO

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE ABOUT A POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT. PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON THE FLOOR WITH ONE SIDE AND BOTTOM WET. RESPONDER OPENED PACKAGE AND FOUND 2 CAP OFF AND AT THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX. FOLLOWING ALL PROPER RESPONDER METHODS, PACKAGE WAS SECRED AND REURNED TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED.
